entries.label: Dadra & Nagar Haveli and Daman & Diu
The Dadra And Nagar Haveli And Daman And Diu
Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology
Ministry of Women and Child Development
Ministry Of Skill Development And Entrepreneurship
Ministry Of Personnel, Public Grievances And Pensions
Ministry Of Petroleum and Natural Gas
Comptroller And Auditor General Of India
Ministry Of Environment,forests and climate change
Ministry Of Consumer Affairs, Food And Public Distribution
Ministry Of Development Of North Eastern Region
Ministry Of Statistics and Programme Implementation
NITI Aayog (National Institution for Transforming India)

fields.schemeName: Mukh‍yamantri Janakal‍yaan (Sambal 2.0) Yojana (Asangathit Karmakaar Man‍da)
fields.briefDescription: The Mukhyamantri Jan Kalyan (Sambal 2.0) Yojana is a initiative of Madhya Pradesh government. The scheme will provide much-needed social security to unorganized workers in the state and help them live a dignified life.

fields.schemeName: Assistance Scheme for Handloom Spinning-Weaving Women Workers
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, provide financial support for traditional women artisans engaged in spinning and weaving. They promote traditional weaving by providing handloom equipment worth up to ₹25,000 with a 90% departmental subsidy.

fields.schemeName: A Program to Provide 90 Percent Assistance in Planting Material of Horticultural Fruit Crops
fields.briefDescription: This scheme offers 90% financial assistance to farmers for purchasing planting materials of fruit crops to promote horticulture.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance/Pension to Former Renowned Sportspersons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide monthly support of ₹4,000 to ₹10,000 for life to financially weak former athletes of the state.

fields.schemeName: Award Scheme to Encourage Entrepreneurs
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to encourage and recognize the exceptional craftsmanship and weaving skills of registered artisans and weavers in the state. It provides awards at both the state and district levels to outstanding performers in the handicrafts and handloom (cotton and woolen textile) sectors.

fields.schemeName: One-Time Grant Money To Soldiers Conferred With Vishisht Seva Medal Award
fields.briefDescription: “One-Time Grant Money To Soldiers Conferred With Vishisht Seva Medal Award” is a social security scheme that provides financial assistance to serving soldiers, former soldiers of the state who have been conferred with “Vishisht Seva Medal Award”.

fields.schemeName: Government-Run Old Age and Infirm Homes
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, free residential, food, clothing, and healthcare are provided to destitute elderly individuals above 60 years in state-run residential facilities.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of New and Renewable Energy
fields.schemeName: PM – Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana
fields.briefDescription: PM Surya Ghar: Muft Bijli Yojana is a government scheme that aims to provide free electricity to households in India.

fields.schemeName: Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (Scheduled Caste Category)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Assistance of Concentrate Feed After Parturition (Scheduled Caste Category)" provides 150 kg of BIS Type II concentrate feed to Scheduled Caste Category livestock owners after parturition to support cattle health, increase milk production, and enhance calf development.

fields.schemeName: Atal Awas Yojana - Uttarakhand
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹1,30,000 is provided for constructing houses in hilly areas and ₹1,20,000 for plain areas to homeless Scheduled Caste families who are below the poverty line (BPL) or fall within a defined income limit.

fields.schemeName: Old Age Pension for the Construction Workers (On Completion Of 60 Years) (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: “Old Age Pension for the Construction Workers (On Completion Of 60 Years)’’ is a social security scheme that provides a monthly pension of ₹1,000 per month to the beneficiaries who have completed 60 years of age.

fields.schemeName: 100% State Government Divyangjan Term Loan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides provide financial support to native residents of Gujarat who have a disability of 40% or more. The eligible individuals can avail of a term loan ranging from ₹50,000/- to ₹1,00,000/- at a concessional interest rate of 6% per annum for a repayment period of five years.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Destitute Elderly and Disabled Person
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Financial Assistance to Destitute Elderly and Disabled Person" provides monthly financial aid to elderly individuals (60+) and severely disabled persons who meet specific income and dependency criteria.

fields.schemeName: Akhilbhartiya Sanskrit Kavi Sammelan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The "Akhilbhartiya Sanskrit Kavi Sammelan Yojana" invites and honors Sanskrit poets who can compose and recite poetry in Sanskrit by providing them a monetary honorarium for participating in state-organized events, especially on national or state festivals in Uttarakhand.

fields.schemeName: Shodhgrantha Chayan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial honorarium and free copies to authors of research manuscripts related to Sanskrit literature and allied disciplines for publication purposes.

fields.schemeName: Research Fellowship Scheme for Scheduled Tribe Candidates
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support the Scheduled Tribe candidates from Scheduled Areas and the Saharia Area of Rajasthan to register themselves as research scholars with all recognized Central/State/Deemed/Private University located in any part of India for pursuing Ph.D. Programme.

fields.schemeName: Saraswati Sadhana Yojana to Socially and Educationally Backward Girls studying in Class 9th
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, free bicycle assistance is provided to Socially and Educationally Backward class girls studying in Class 9 in government and grant-in-aid schools across Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Assistance for Daughters’ Marriage of the Construction Workers (UKBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: “Assistance for Daughters’ Marriage of the Construction Workers” is a social security scheme that aims to provide financial assistance for the marriage of the female workers and their daughters.

fields.schemeName: Prakashan Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support original literary/research work related to tribal communities. Authors are provided financial assistance of ₹6,000 to ₹12,000 for publication.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry of Fisheries,Animal Husbandry and Dairying
fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Kisan Samridhi Sah-yojana (PM-MKSSY): COMPONENT 1A: Formalization of Fisheries Sector and Facilitating Access of Fisheries Microenterprises to Government of India Programs for Working Capital Financing
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to formalise fisheries microenterprises and facilitate their access to institutional working capital finance through small grants and credit intermediaries. It benefits fisheries sector stakeholders registered on NFDP with verifiable credit needs and valid bank accounts.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance Scheme for Journalists and Litterateurs - Rajasthan
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial support to journalists and litterateurs for the treatment of critical illnesses, medical emergencies and no source of income, unemployment, or advanced age.

fields.schemeName: Pension Scheme for Elderly and Destitute Artists/Writers/Authors of Uttarakhand State
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to financially support senior contributors in the arts and literature. It provides a monthly pension to eligible beneficiaries.

fields.schemeName: Special Incentive to ST (P)/OBC/MOBC Meritorious Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial grants to meritorious ST (P)/OBC/MOBC students in Assam who secure high marks in Matriculation, 10+2, Graduation, or Post Graduation. Benefits include fixed monetary assistance ranging from ₹10,000/- to ₹25,000/- based on educational level.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance for UPSC/APSC Mains Exam
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides financial assistance to ST and OBC/MOBC students of Assam who have cleared the APSC/UPSC preliminary exam and are appearing for the mains exam in the current year.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Swarojgar Yojna
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance for new projects and for upgrading small-scale existing industries. Through this scheme, bank loans with subsidies are provided to eligible state residents.

fields.schemeName: Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Akhil Bharatiya Civil Services Pratiyogita" by the Dept. of Sports, Government of Uttarakhand, aims to encourage sports participation among government employees. Through this scheme, selected employees receive allowances and facilities for participating in national-level competition.

fields.schemeName: Coaching Scheme for Divyang Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Coaching Scheme for Divyang Students" by the National Institute for the Empowerment of Persons with Visual Disabilities (NIEPVD), Dehradun, aims to support students with disabilities in preparing for competitive government examinations.

fields.schemeName: Grant to Films - Films in Hindi and the Languages Listed in 8th Schedule of the Constitution of India
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial grants and performance-based incentives are provided to the film producers who shoot films in Hindi or in the languages listed in the 8th Schedule of the Indian Constitution within Uttarakhand.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Mangal Dals
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, Mangal Dals affiliated with the department are given monetary assistance to start employment-oriented projects in 18 identified business sectors such as dairy, electronics, tent services, beauty parlors, and more.

fields.schemeName: Organization of Sports Competitions and Training Programs
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, cash prizes and free training are provided to talented players and encourage participation at multiple levels like Gram Panchayat, Development Block, District, and state while providing an opportunity for free training to meritorious players before competing at the state level.

fields.schemeName: Financial Assistance to Permanent Residents of Uttarakhand for Religious Pilgrimages
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote religious tourism by supporting eligible residents who complete the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra. Financial assistance is provided upon completion.

fields.schemeName: Scholarship for Poor Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support poor students in sanskrit education. One student per class receives a scholarship equal to the class tuition fee.

fields.schemeName: Samman Pension
fields.briefDescription: "Samman Pension" is a social welfare scheme that provides a monthly pension to all the first generation living legal heirs of a freedom fighter of the state.

fields.schemeName: Monthly/ Family Pension to the Freedom Fighters and their Widows
fields.briefDescription: "Monthly/ Family Pension to the Freedom Fighters and their Widows" is a social welfare scheme that provides a monthly/ family pension to the freedom fighters and their widows domiciled in the state of Uttarakhand.

fields.schemeName: Intensive Fisheries Development Programme - Subsidy on Solar System for fish/shrimp culture
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, subsidies on solar systems for fish/shrimp culture are provided to eligible fish and shrimp farmers. The subsidy is given at 60% of the total project cost, or ₹30,000 per kW, whichever is lower. The maximum subsidy is limited to 30 kW for shrimp farmers and 10 kW for fish farmers.

fields.schemeName: New Charkha-Loom Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides 65% financial assistance for purchasing Amber Charkhas (₹13,000/-) and looms (₹30,000/-) to registered Khadi spinners and weavers, promoting sustainable livelihoods.

fields.schemeName: Subsidy on Rehri alongwith (Stove, Gas Chulha, Utensil etc.) for the Fish/Fish Product Sale
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance will be provided for purchase of a handcart along with essential items such as stove, gas chulha, utensils, etc., for fish and fish product sales. A subsidy of 60% on the total project cost of ₹60,000/- will be granted, amounting to ₹36,000/- per beneficiary.

fields.schemeName: Solar Water Heater Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide clean and affordable energy, reduce electricity bills, and contribute to environmental protection. Through this scheme, free electricity and a reduction in carbon emissions are provided to the residents of Uttarakhand.

fields.schemeName: Uniform Assistance for Economically Backward Class Students Studying in Class 1st to 8th
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Uniform Assistance for Economically Backward Class Students Studying in Class 1st to 8th" by the Social Justice and Empowerment Department, Gujarat, provides ₹900/- for three pairs of uniforms to students from economically weaker sections in government and aided primary schools.

fields.schemeName: Indira Amma Bhojanalya
fields.briefDescription: The primary objective of the scheme is to provide nutritious and affordable food to the poor and needy sections of society and to economically strengthen rural women's self-help groups (SHGs) by providing continuous income-generating employment through the operation of these canteens.

fields.schemeName: Grant for Purchase of Tools (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme is implemented by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board. Under this scheme, registered construction workers who have completed skill upgradation training are provided financial assistance of upto ₹15,000/- for purchasing trade-related tools.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: National Agriculture Market
fields.briefDescription: Launched on 14th April 2016, e-NAM is a pan-India electronic trading platform that links existing mandis to create a unified online market for agricultural commodities, promoting “One Nation One Market” and enabling transparent, efficient, and nationwide agri-trade.

fields.schemeName: PMMSY: Construction of Fish Retail Markets including Ornamental Fish/Aquarium Markets - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to support the construction of fish retail markets, including those for ornamental fish and aquariums. Through this scheme, financial assistance for project costs is provided to individual beneficiaries.

fields.schemeName: Foreign Study Loan
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to provide financial assistance to students from non-reserved categories for pursuing higher studies abroad in medical and post-graduation courses. It offers loans up to ₹15,00,000/- at 4% simple interest per annum to eligible students.

fields.schemeName: Development Support for Coffee growers of North- Eastern Region (NER) : Support for Consolidation of Coffee
fields.briefDescription: To increase the productivity of the existing coffee holdings by gap filling / rejuvenation followed with improved cultivation methods like application of compost, bush management, shade management, pest & disease control etc.

fields.schemeName: Market Development and Export Promotion : Support for Value Addition (R&G)
fields.briefDescription: To enhance quality of coffee product and achieve value addition through roasting, grinding and packaging which will result in boosting domestic coffee consumption and entrepreneurship in the coffee sector.

fields.schemeName: Coffee Development Programme in Non-Traditional Areas (NTA) : Market Support
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to extend support to the tribal growers, for taking up marketing of their coffee on community based approach, through suitable financial incentives

fields.schemeName: Market Development and Export Promotion : National Coffee Competitions
fields.briefDescription: To cater to the need of the coffee industry by providing a training platform for coffee start-ups with hands on training in Roasting, Grinding and Packaging of coffee

fields.schemeName: Scheme of Publication Grant/Subsidy for Publication of Doctoral Thesis/Research Report/ Papers Presented in Seminars/Conferences, etc.
fields.briefDescription: The Indian Council of Social Science Research (ICSSR), under the Ministry of Education, Government of India, provides financial assistance for the publication of high-quality doctoral theses, research project/fellowship reports, and seminar/conference papers in the field of social sciences.

fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan (PM-USP) Central Sector Scheme of Scholarship for College and University students
fields.briefDescription: A scholarship scheme by the Dept. of Higher Education to provide financial assistance to meritorious students from poor families to meet a part of their day-to-day expenses while pursuing higher studies. The scholarships are awarded on the basis of results of Higher Secondary / Class 12th Board Exam

fields.schemeName: Scheme for the Welfare of Schedule Caste Families in Fisheries Sector: Subsidy on 1st Year Lease Money
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide full-time employment to individuals from Scheduled Caste families in the fisheries sector and to uplift these families by promoting fish farming through financial assistance for leasing Panchayati ponds or watershed areas.

fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Three Wheeler with Ice Box Including E-rickshaws for Fish Vending - Haryana
fields.briefDescription: The scheme aims to promote hygienic and efficient fish transportation and retailing through mobile outlets. Under this scheme, financial assistance is provided to eligible beneficiaries for purchasing e-rickshaws equipped with ice boxes for selling fish directly.

fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Matsya Sampada Yojana: Mini Fish Feed Mills of Production Capacity of 2 Ton /Day
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, financial assistance, in form of subsidy, is provided to individuals for setting up mini feed mills, ensuring the local availability of quality fish feed at affordable prices for fishers and fish farmers.

fields.schemeName: Publication Support Scheme for Fine Arts
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Publication Support Scheme for Fine Arts" by the Sports, Youth and Cultural Activities Department, Government of Gujarat, aims to encourage the publication of fine arts books through financial assistance provided to artists and art institutions.

fields.schemeName: Kabir Anthyesthi Anudan Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, a one-time grant of ₹3,000/- is given to the family/dependent of the deceased to cover funeral expenses. The grant is provided for the death of any person of any age from a Below Poverty Line (BPL) family.

fields.schemeName: Family Pension (BBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme "Family Pension" by the Bihar Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (BBOCWWB), Labour Resources Department, Government of Bihar, provides pension to the dependent of the deceased pensioner of the Board.

fields.schemeName: Assistance to Farmers in Purchasing Nano Fertilizers Under the Agricultural Assistance Program for Farmers Other than Scheduled Castes and Scheduled Tribes
fields.briefDescription: This scheme offers financial assistance to farmers from non-SC/ST categories to support the purchase of Nano Fertilizers, aiming to enhance agricultural productivity and uplift the standard of living of farmers in Gujarat.

fields.schemeName: Solar Home System (Manohar Jyoti)
fields.briefDescription: The "Solar Home System (Manohar Jyoti)" by the Renewable Energy Department, Government of Haryana, aims to promote renewable energy adoption and ensure sustainable power access through solar solutions. Through this scheme, a subsidized solar home lighting system is provided to families.

fields.schemeName: Panchayat Secretariat Strengthening Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The "Panchayat Secretariat Strengthening Scheme" by the Panchayati Raj Department, Government of Jharkhand, aims to provide financial assistance of ₹15,000 per month to each Gram Panchayat for operational and maintenance purposes, ensuring efficient governance at the grassroots level.

fields.schemeName: demo7
fields.briefDescription: test

fields.schemeName: Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan Yojana - Special Scholarship Scheme for Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh
fields.briefDescription: This initiative provides academic fees and maintenance allowances to support students from Jammu & Kashmir and Ladakh pursuing higher education outside the Union Territories

fields.schemeName: Testing Equipment Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Haryana launched the Testing Equipment Assistance Scheme to support Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) in enhancing product quality through financial aid for procuring testing equipment.

fields.schemeName: Access To Knowledge For Technology Development And Dissemination (A2K+) - Studies
fields.briefDescription: Access to Knowledge for Technology Development and Dissemination (A2K+) is a scheme targeted towards developing mechanisms to disseminate science, technology and innovation-related information to industries, research and academic institutions

fields.schemeName: Bebe Nanki Laadli Beti Kalyan Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Bebe Nanki Laadli Beti Kalyan Scheme was launched under the 13th Finance Commission component for "measures to improve gender ratio" in the Punjab State from 2011-12.

fields.schemeName: Dai Didi Mobile Clinic Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Government of Chhattisgarh state, started a scheme named "Dai Didi Clinic Scheme" in 2020.

fields.schemeName: Grants In Aid To SC/ST Patients Suffering From Cancer And Other Malignant Diseases
fields.briefDescription: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance in the form of one-time grants to patients undergoing medical treatment in connection with T.B., Cancer and other malignant diseases. This scheme provides one-time financial assistance to patients belonging to the Tea Tribes community.

fields.schemeName: Bicycle Scheme (HBOCWWB)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Bicycle Scheme (HBOCWWB)” was launched by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department Haryana.

fields.schemeName: Super 5000
fields.briefDescription: In 2017, Madhya Pradesh State Government started a scheme "Super 5000" for student scholarships.

fields.schemeName: Jharkhand Nirman Karmakar Mrityu/Durghatana Sahayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: "Jharkhand Nirman Karmakar Mrityu/Durghatana Sahayata Yojana" is a 100% State Sponsored scheme by the Department of Labour, Employment, Training & Skill Development Govt of Jharkhand. The scheme provides social security to all registered workers in the age group of 18-60 years.

fields.schemeName: Tuition Fees And Examination Fees To Vjnt/sbc Students Studying In High Schools
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Maharashtra introduced Tuition fees and Examination fees to Vimukta Jati Nomadic Tribes (VJNT)/ Special Backward Classes (SBC) students studying in High Schools scheme to improve interest of VJNT/SBC students.

fields.schemeName: Award For Meritorious Students Of Meghalaya In The HSSLC Examination (Science Stream)
fields.briefDescription: The Directorate of Educational Research & Training Meghalaya, Shillong is implementing a scheme in providing a one-time award for meritorious tribal students of Meghalaya who passed the current HSSLC Examination (Science) every year.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivaah / Nikaah Yojana
fields.briefDescription: In 2006, Madhya Pradesh State Government started the "Mukhyamantri Kanya Vivaah Yojana" for females/girls.

fields.schemeName: Self Employment Scheme
fields.briefDescription: Under this scheme, Subsidies will be provided to the religious minority communities with the help of Nationalized / Scheduled banks to start or improve a small-scale handicraft industry, service sector,  and agro-based activities.

fields.schemeName: Old-Age Pension Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Himachal Pradesh government offers an Old Age pension scheme to support elderly citizens who have no means of livelihood. The scheme offers financial assistance to eligible citizens based on their age and income level.

fields.schemeName: Upgrading the Skills and Training in Traditional Arts/Crafts for Development
fields.briefDescription: The Upgrading the Skills and Training in Traditional Arts/Crafts for Development (USTTAD) scheme is a program launched by the Ministry of Minority Affairs, Government of India, in 2015.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: Rainfed Area Development
fields.briefDescription: Rainfed Area Development (RAD) scheme was launched in 2014-15 to mainstream development of rainfed areas in a sustainable manner. It adopts an area-based approach, focuses on Integrated Farming System (IFS) for enhancing productivity and minimizing risks associated with climatic variability.

fields.schemeName: Seva Bhoj Yojna
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Seva Bhoj Yojna” was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India and it has been made operational with effect from the 1st of August, 2018. The scheme shall be applicable within the territorial jurisdiction of India and will remain open from the 1st to 15th of every month.

fields.schemeName: Internship Scheme For Students Of Counselling/ Psychology/ Social Work/ Home Science Etc
fields.briefDescription: The objective of this scheme is to offer aspiring postgraduate students an opportunity for internship facilities to be trained as qualified interns in state-run private children's and shelter homes who can be offered hands-on job training experience.

fields.schemeName: Development of Industrie-Training Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Puducherry introduced the Scheme Development Of Industries-Training Scheme for the candidates to develop their skills to enable them to start their own ventures or to get suitable employment opportunity by sponsoring to selected short term trades.

fields.schemeName: Shaikshanik Chatravriti Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Under MP Shram Kalyan Shaikshanik Chatravriti Yojana, scholarships will be provided to the students in the state to continue their education.

fields.schemeName: Devnarayan Pre-Matric Scholarship Scheme
fields.briefDescription: In Rajasthan, the Pre-Matriculation scholarship scheme is run by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment for the educational upliftment of Very Backward Class students.

fields.schemeName: Mukhyamantri Nirmaan Majadur Kaushal vikaas evan Parivaar Sashaktikaran Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started "Mukhyamantri Nirmaan Majadur Kaushal Vikaas Evan Parivaar Sashaktikaran Yojana" for Building and other construction workers.

fields.schemeName: Scheme For Grant Of Rewards To The Children Of Salt Labourers
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scheme for Grant of Rewards to the Children of Salt Labourers” was launched by Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT), Ministry of Commerce and Industry in the year 1985.

fields.schemeName: Tuition Fees And Examination Fees To Vjnt Students
fields.briefDescription: The Government of Maharashtra launched a scheme namely "Tuition fees and examination fees to Vimukta Jati and Nomadic Tribes (VJNT) students.

fields.schemeName: Scheme for Promoting Young Talents in Science-I
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scheme for Promoting Young Talents in Science-I (SPYTiS-I)” is constituted for the purpose of providing financial and technical assistance to talented young students who have innovative ideas in scientific/technological pursuits.

fields.schemeName: Readymade Kichan Sahaayata Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme "Readymade Kitchen Sahaayata Yojana" for unorganized worker on 19 June 2017.

fields.schemeName: Scheme Of Assistance To Persons With Disabilities For Purchase/Fitting Of Aids And Appliances
fields.briefDescription: "Scheme of Assistance to Persons with Disabilities for Purchase/Fitting of Aids and Appliances" is a scheme by the Social Welfare Department, Govt. of Manipur. In this scheme, the PwD is provided with Financial Assistance for the Purchase/Fitting of Hearing Aids, Artificial Limbs, etc.

fields.schemeName: Seed Capital Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Seed Capital Scheme” is a scheme by the Department of Information Technology, Electronics and Communications, Government of Goa, for the Startups of Goa. Through this scheme, startups with a promising idea can get a one-time grant of up to ₹ 10,00,000.

fields.schemeName: Back-to-Lab Research Fellowship Programme
fields.briefDescription: To facilitate the re-entry of women having a career break to Science research, the Kerala State Council of Science, Technology and Environment (KSCSTE) launched the “Back-to-Lab Research Fellowship Programme” in 2010.

fields.schemeName: Integrated Horticulture Development
fields.briefDescription: Under Horticulture sector 'Integrated Horticulture Development' is a major State Plan scheme which supports different activities like necessary civil works, grants-in-aid to the horticulture growers, procurement of tools and equipment's, introduction of new technology etc.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Scheme of Grant-in-Aid to Voluntary and other Organizations Working for Scheduled Castes
fields.briefDescription: The "Scheme aims to enhance the reach of development interventions of the Government and fill the gaps in service-deficient Scheduled Caste-dominant areas in sectors such as education, health, vocational training, etc., through the efforts of voluntary organizations and other organizations.

fields.schemeName: Vidyajyothi Scheme- Financial Aid For Uniforms And Study Materials To PH Students
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Vidyajyothi Scheme- Financial Aid for Uniforms and Study Materials to PH Students” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.schemeName: Safai Karmakaar Ke Putr/Putri Hetu Vishesh Coaching Yojana
fields.briefDescription: Chhattisgarh State Government started a scheme "Safai Karmakaar Ke Putr/Putri Hetu Vishesh Coaching Yojana" for unorganized worker on 28 April 2012.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
fields.schemeName: Dr Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme of Interest Subsidy on Educational Loans for Overseas Studies for Other Backward Classes (OBCs) and Economically Backward Classes (EBCs)
fields.briefDescription: The scheme provides interest subsidy to the students belonging to the OBCs and EBCs on the interest payable for the period of the moratorium for the Education Loans for overseas studies to pursue approved courses of studies abroad at Masters, M.Phil. and PhD level.

fields.schemeName: Rehabilitation Treatment For The Disabled
fields.briefDescription: The government of Meghalaya provides rehabilitation treatment for persons with disabilities under the "Disability Rehabilitation Scheme".

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare
fields.schemeName: Integrated Scheme on Agriculture Cooperation
fields.briefDescription: The Integrated Scheme on Agriculture Cooperation (ISAC) is a Central Sector Scheme of the Ministry of Agriculture and Farmers Welfare, Government of India. It is being implemented through the National Cooperative Development Corporation (NCDC).

fields.schemeName: Mangalya Scheme For Widow Remarriage
fields.briefDescription: The “Mangalya Scheme” was launched by the Department of Women and Child Development, Government of Kerala. Under the scheme, financial assistance is to be provided to eligible widows and divorced women for their remarriage.

fields.schemeName: Scheme For Providing Assistive Devices To Differently Abled Persons
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Scheme for Providing Assistive Devices to Differently Abled Persons” was launched by the Department of Social Justice, Government of Kerala.

fields.nodalMinistryName: Ministry Of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises
fields.schemeName: Coir Vikas Yojana- Coir Industry Technology Upgradation Scheme
fields.briefDescription: The scheme “Coir Industry Technology Upgradation Scheme (CITUS)” is a component of “Coir Vikas Yojana” and the scheme was launched by Ministry of Micro, Small & Medium Enterprises, Government of India.

fields.schemeName: Entrepreneurship Development by SC & ST Women in Science Technology Engineering Mathematics
fields.briefDescription: ED/SC-ST- WISTEM)” is aimed for exploring the potential of entrepreneurship along with improvement in the livelihood options for unemployed SC & ST women in Science, Technology, Engineering & Mathematics (STEM) areas using tools of Science, Technology & Innovation.
